definition: Hua Tuo (?-208), famous doctor at the end of Han Dynasty
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua

sentences.english: When they woke up, we went to climb the park again.
sentences.chinese: 當她們醒來之後，我們又去爬華佗山公園了。

sentences.english: When treating illness, he even utilized psychological methods.
sentences.chinese: 在治療疾病時，華佗甚至已經運用了心理療法。

sentences.english: I took my daughter to HuaTuo Mountain Park this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上，我帶女兒去爬華佗山公園了。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the efficacy of Huatuo Jaji points for treating chronic gastritis patients.
sentences.chinese: 目的觀察採用華佗夾脊穴治療慢性胃炎的療效。

sentences.english: After washing the clothes and having breakfast, we went to the Hua Tuo Mountain Park again.
sentences.chinese: 洗完衣服喫過早餐之後，我們又去爬華佗山公園了。

sentences.english: I have no fear.” Hua cut the skin and flesh open and scraped the bone with scalpel.
sentences.chinese: 華佗切開肉皮，用刀刮骨。

sentences.english: Then he gave orders to hold a dinner for Hua Tuo.
Hua Tuo attached importance to therapy. He also emphasized prevention.
sentences.chinese: 華佗在醫療上有突出貢獻，同時強調預防。

sentences.english: Nobody could save him even though Hua Tuo should come here.
sentences.chinese: 即使華佗在世也救不了他。

definition: to pass on the light of Buddha

the Book of History, one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1], a compendium of documents which make up the oldest extant texts of Chinese history, from legendary times down to the time of Confucius, also known as 尚書經|尚书经[Shang4 shu1 jing1], 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], 書|书[Shu1]
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) founded by Zou Yan 鄒衍|邹衍[Zou1 Yan3]
Zou Yan (305-240 BC), founder of the School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
